tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Schenker to Felix Salzer, dated September 13, 1934

tei:transcription.tei:p: [Absender:] [rubber stamp:] Dr. HEINRICH SCHENKER WIEN, III., Keilgasse 8
[An:] H. [/] D^r^ [/] Felix Salzer Wien, XIII Maxinggasse 12

Mein lieber D^r^ Salzer! The writing of postcards to Salzer and Oswald Jonas is recorded jointly in Schenker's diary at OJ 4/7, p. 3944. These relate to a postcard that Schenker received from Wilhelm Altmann the previous day, recorded on the same page of the diary.

Prof. D^r^ Wilh. Altmann, Click on Wilhelm Altmann. Berlin-Friedenau Lauterstr. 38^II^ (ehemals Dir. der preuß. Staats- bibliothek) bittet mich, Sie zu veranlassen, daß Sie ihm Notizen über sich für <del>sein</del> die neue Auflage seines Tonkünstler-Lexikons einsenden mögen. Den selben Wunsch Prof. A's habe ich auch an D^r^ Jonas| Click on Oswald Jonas. zu vermitteln gehabt. Auch dieses ist geschehen. Schenker wrote a postcard to Jonas on the same day (September 13, 1934, OJ 5/18, 55), informing him of Altmann's request and telling him he would be conveying the same message to Salzer.

Wie geht es ihnen? Am Dienstag hatte ich den Besuch Otto Klemperers Click on Otto Klemperer. Klemperer's visit took place on Tuesday, September 11, 1934. It had been scheduled for September 10, but Klemperer had had to call it off and reschedule (OC 44/28, undated; diary OJ 4/7, p. 3943, September 10, 1934). Schenker sent something to Klemperer for which the postal receipt dated September 20, 1934 survives (OC 44/29, for which Klemperer's thanks are probably OC 44/27). bei mir zu verzeichnen.
Mit besten Grüßen von uns Beiden

tei:p.tei:hi: Handwritten postcard from Schenker to Felix Salzer, dated September 13, 1934

tei:translation.tei:p: [From:] [rubber stamp:] Dr. HEINRICH SCHENKER VIENNA III, Keilgasse 8
[To:] Dr. Felix Salzer Vienna XIII, Maxinggasse 12

Prof. Dr. Wilhelm Altmann Berlin-Friedenau, Lauterstrasse 38^II^ (former director of the Prussian State Library) asks that I request you to send him notes about yourself for <del>his</del> the new edition of his Tonkünstler-Lexikon. I was also asked to make the same request to Dr. Jonas; this has been done.
How are you? I can report that on Tuesday I received a visit from Otto Klemperer.
With best wishes from us both,
